Content:: Don Edwin Malawaraarachchi (born 27 December 1925) was a Sri Lankan politician.[1] He first contested 6th parliamentary election, held on 22 March 1965, as an Independent politician in the Rakwana electorate, coming fourth in a field of five candidates, receiving 142 votes.[2] He then ran in the 8th parliamentary election, held on 21 July 1977, as the United National Party candidate, in the seat of Kamburupitiya. He was successful, receiving 22,306 votes (52.3% of the total vote) defeating the sitting member, Aelian Mahanaga Nanayakkara.[3] In September 1978 Malawaraarachchi was ordered by the United National Party Disciplinary Committee to resign his seat in Parliament as a result of adverse findings against him by the three member special Committee.[4] He was replaced by Albert Silva on 22 November 1979.
Title: Don Edwin Malawaraarachchi - Wikipedia
